channel.title: Client.Java
channel.description: Someone needs to make a clear explaination of what has to be done with this, I and many others are stuck with how to spawn items, I know you can do ::pickup # #, and ::Item #, but people speak of client.java will help but where is it, I got someone that said its in Hybridscape but its not there or me, its in serverlists for me, and its a client.class not client.java.

item.title: Client.Java
item.dc:creator: @p_a_r_t_y_b_o_y p a r t y b o y
item.description:
@p_a_r_t_y_b_o_y wrote:

i have not a clue of what your talking about dude.

Read full topic

item.title: Client.Java
item.dc:creator: @Havok Havok
item.description:
@Havok wrote:

Client.Java is in the client folder.
The thing that you play your server on(MoparScape) is a CLIENT.The CLIENT is a “window” to your server.
Your SERVER is the thing that you need the client to access.Servers like CheezScape(the one i use),or WhiteScape(not to sure of this one).The client.java that everyone seems so baffled about is a text file in your client folder.Your client folder should be in C:\Program Files\Java.Because I use CheezScape,mine is called CheezScape.In the CLIENT folder is a text file called Client.Its not technically a text file,its a java file,as underneath the words “client” it says “JAVA file”.There you have your “client.java”,the big mystery of making your own server.Someone correct me if I’m wrong(I could be :S)

Read full topic

item.title: Client.Java
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

You can decompile client.class into client.java with a java decompiler.
But maybe they are talking about clienthandler.java?

Read full topic
